item.title: 4 - Basics
item.description: Definition 4.1.1 test Let $A \subseteq \mathbb{R}$. A point $c \in \mathbb{R}$ is a cluster point of A if for every $\delta > 0$, there exists $x \in A, x \ne c$ such that $|x - c| < \delta$. rephrase: A point $c \in \mathbb{R}$ is a cluster point of A if there exists $x \in A, x \ne c$ in every $\delta-$neighborhood $V_\delta (c) = (c-\delta, c+\delta)$.
